text: Thanks for the explanation everyone! Currently I do use a sandbox account for development so I'll just keep doing that in conjunction with the local dev setup until it can all be done locally
I have no choice but to use 2FA, is there a workaround for this?

You can use the CMS CLI and the `upload` and `fetch` commands. There also is a `watch` command that will automatically upload files and the CLI supports modes so that changes can be made only to drafts.

^ this.

The other suggestion is to make a dedicated FTP account without 2fa enabled, but that's always seemed like too much of a hassle for me.
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tools/local-development> can help you when it comes to getting started
Thank you! Just what I needed

assuming this is a known bug, but if not using draft mode and you make an edit in the cloud IDE, your watched changes will not take effect since there are pending changes in the DM. Just took me ~5 mins to figure out why changes weren't overwriting. Might be nice if that's something that could be reported in the terminal "changes not applied because of draft conflict with cloud Design Manager" or something like that
that sounds like a bug to me. weâ€™ll take a look.
in this case, were you using the default `mode` of `publish`?
and which version are you on `hscms --version`?
looks like default, and current version
